skill.name: global-coding-style
skill.description: Maintain consistent code formatting, naming conventions, type safety, and automated code quality standards across PHP and TypeScript/JavaScript. Use this skill when writing or editing any PHP files (.php), TypeScript/JavaScript files (.ts, .tsx, .js, .jsx), when implementing type declarations and return types, when running code formatters (Laravel Pint, Ultracite) or linters, when running static analysis tools (Larastan), when naming variables, functions, classes, or files, when applying DRY principles, when removing dead code, or when preparing code for review or commit.
skill.summary: Maintain consistent code formatting, naming conventions, type safety, and automated code quality sta...
skill.author: DevanB

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing metadata and prompt guidance. No executable code exists - only SKILL.md with coding standards documentation. The static scanner flagged benign text patterns as cryptographic/path traversal issues, but all 13 findings are false positives. The skill has zero attack surface: no scripts, no network calls, no filesystem operations beyond reading its own documentation file.

content.value_statement: Inconsistent code styles create technical debt and slow down team collaboration. This skill provides Claude Code with comprehensive coding standards for PHP and TypeScript, ensuring every file follows uniform formatting, naming conventions, and type safety rules.
actual_capabilities: Enforces PHP code formatting using Laravel Pint and Ultracite
Ensures TypeScript/JavaScript follows consistent style guidelines
Validates explicit return type declarations and parameter type hints
Applies DRY principles to eliminate code duplication
Removes unused imports, dead code, and commented-out blocks
Runs Larastan (PHPStan) for static analysis validation
limitations: Does not automatically fix issues in existing files - only applies during new edits
Does not configure IDE settings or editor plugins
Relies on external tools (Pint, Ultracite, Larastan) being installed
Cannot modify project configuration files automatically

use_cases.title: PHP Code Standards
use_cases.description: Maintain consistent PHP code formatting across Laravel applications using Laravel Pint and type safety enforcement

use_cases.title: TypeScript Style Guide
use_cases.description: Ensure React and Node.js projects follow uniform naming conventions and type declarations

use_cases.title: Team Code Quality
use_cases.description: Establish and enforce coding standards that reduce code review time and improve maintainability

prompt_templates.title: Format PHP File
prompt_templates.prompt: Format this PHP code using Laravel Pint standards. Add explicit return types to all methods and type hints to parameters. Remove any unused imports or dead code.

prompt_templates.title: Format TypeScript
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Ultracite formatting to this TypeScript file. Ensure all functions have explicit return types. Use proper naming conventions for variables and classes.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor Duplication
prompt_templates.prompt: Find and eliminate duplicated code in these files using DRY principles. Extract common logic into reusable functions or classes.

prompt_templates.title: Run Static Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Run Larastan to check for type errors and code quality issues. Fix any violations found and ensure all PHP code passes static analysis.

output_examples.input: Format this PHP class with proper coding standards
output: Added return type declarations to 5 methods

output_examples.input: Refactor this TypeScript component to follow naming conventions
output: Added explicit return types to 3 functions

output_examples.input: Clean up duplicated logic in these files
output: Extracted common logic into shared utility file

best_practices: Run Laravel Pint after completing PHP edits to auto-format code
Add type hints and return types when writing new PHP methods
Use Larastan as a pre-commit check to catch type errors early
anti_patterns: Leaving return types off PHP methods (violates type safety)
Keeping unused imports in code (adds unnecessary bloat)
Duplicating logic instead of creating reusable functions

faq.question: Which file types does this skill support?
faq.answer: PHP (.php) and TypeScript/JavaScript (.ts, .tsx, .js, .jsx) files are supported.

faq.question: What tools are required for this skill?
faq.answer: Laravel Pint for PHP, Ultracite for JavaScript/TypeScript, and Larastan for static analysis.

faq.question: Does this skill modify existing files automatically?
faq.answer: It applies standards during edits but does not auto-fix all existing files in a codebase.

faq.question: Is any data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No. This skill is purely documentation-based and makes no network calls.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Run Pint and Larastan as part of your pre-commit hooks or CI pipeline scripts.

faq.question: How is this different from editor plugins?
faq.answer: This skill guides Claude Code's output directly, ensuring AI-generated code follows standards from the start.
